abstract: Fierce backlash has developed against NHL's crackdown on boarding and checks to the head, especially in Canada, where reports on long-term effects of blows to players' heads has been dominating the news; outspoken TV commentator Don Cherry is a vocal critic of the new rules.
snippet: The relatively small backlash against the rules highlights how much the discussion over the physical nature of hockey has evolved — especially in Canada.
lead_paragraph: The relatively small backlash against the rules highlights how much the discussion over the physical nature of hockey has evolved — especially in Canada.

headline.main: Debate Sharpens Over N.H.L. Safety Rules and Fighting
headline.print_headline: Debate Sharpens Over N.H.L. Safety Rules
headline.seo: Debate Sharpens Over N.H.L. Safety Rules and Fighting
